MS MCQs

    Introduction to using Power Automate buttons

    »

    1. How many button options are available to trigger a flow?

      Two, with user input and without user input.

      Three, with user input, without user input and a physical button.

      Four, with user input, without user input, virtual button and physical button.

      Five, with user input, without user input, virtual button, physical button and another flow.


    2. Which of the following ways can you share a button in Power Automate?

      By adding individual users only.

      By adding individual users or Office 365 groups.

      By adding individual users, Office 365 groups or Exchange mailboxes.

      By adding individual users, Office 365 groups, Exchange mailboxes or SharePoint groups.


    3. What are the three verifications that you should make when troubleshooting a flow?

      Internet connection, device OS, and language

      Device OS, location, and screen size

      User authorization, data connections, and Power Automate actions or conditions

      User interface, flow condition, and internet connection


    4. What time and location do trigger tokens use?

      The time and geographic location of the user’s office

      The time and geographic location of the tenant’s HQ office

      The time and geographic location of the tenant’s Office 365 global admin

      The time and geographic location of the device


    5. Can a button flow be built entirely from the Power Automate mobile app?

      Yes, with triggers, actions, and conditions

      No, you have to use a computer

      Partially. You can add the button and trigger only. Actions and conditions need you to use a computer.
